verses.verse: And it came <S%G1096><s%> to pass, as he went <S%G2064><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> the house <S%G3624><s%> of one <S%G5100><s%> of the chief <S%G758><s%> Pharisees <S%G5330><s%> to eat <S%G5315><s%> bread <S%G740><s%> on the sabbath <S%G4521><s%> day, that they watched <S%G3906><s%> him.
And, behold, <S%G2400><s%> there was a certain <S%G5100><s%> man <S%G444><s%> before <S%G1715><s%> him which had the dropsy. <S%G5203><s%>

And Jesus <S%G2424><s%> answering <S%G611><s%> spoke <S%G2036><s%> to the lawyers <S%G3544><s%> and Pharisees, <S%G5330><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> Is it lawful <S%G1832><s%> to heal <S%G2323><s%> on the sabbath <S%G4521><s%> day?
And they held <S%G2270><s%> their peace. <S%G2270><s%> And he took <S%G1949><s%> him, and healed <S%G2323><s%> him, and let him go; <S%G630><s%>

And answered <S%G611><s%> them, saying, <S%G2036><s%> Which <S%G5101><s%> of you shall have an ass <S%G3688><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> an ox <S%G1016><s%> fallen <S%G1706><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> a pit, <S%G5421><s%> and will not straightway <S%G2112><s%> pull <S%G385><s%> him out on <S%G1722><s%> the sabbath <S%G4521><s%> day? <S%G2250><s%>
And they could <S%G2480><s%> not answer <S%G470><s%> him again <S%G470><s%> to these <S%G5023><s%> things.

And he put <S%G3004><s%> forth <S%G3004><s%> a parable <S%G3850><s%> to those <S%G3588><s%> which were bidden, <S%G2564><s%> when he marked <S%G1907><s%> how <S%G4459><s%> they chose <S%G1586><s%> out the chief <S%G4411><s%> rooms; <S%G4411><s%> saying <S%G3004><s%> to them.

When <S%G3752><s%> you are bidden <S%G2564><s%> of any <S%G5100><s%> man <S%G444><s%> to a wedding, <S%G1062><s%> sit <S%G2625><s%> not down <S%G2625><s%> in the highest <S%G4411><s%> room; <S%G4411><s%> lest <S%G3379><s%> a more honorable <S%G1784><s%> man <S%G444><s%> than you be bidden <S%G2564><s%> of him;

And he that bade <S%G2564><s%> you and him come <S%G2064><s%> and say <S%G2046><s%> to you, Give <S%G1325><s%> this <S%G5129><s%> man <S%G444><s%> place; <S%G5117><s%> and you begin <S%G756><s%> with shame <S%G152><s%> to take <S%G2722><s%> the lowest <S%G2078><s%> room. <S%G5117><s%>

But when <S%G3752><s%> you are bidden, <S%G2564><s%> go <S%G4198><s%> and sit <S%G377><s%> down <S%G377><s%> in the lowest <S%G2078><s%> room; <S%G5117><s%> that when <S%G3752><s%> he that bade <S%G2564><s%> you comes, <S%G2064><s%> he may say <S%G2036><s%> to you, Friend, <S%G5384><s%> go <S%G4320><s%> up higher: <S%G511><s%> then <S%G5119><s%> shall you have <S%G2071><s%> worship <S%G1391><s%> in the presence <S%G1799><s%> of them that sit <S%G4873><s%> at <S%G4873><s%> meat with you.

For whoever <S%G3956><s%> <S%G3588><s%> exalts <S%G5312><s%> himself <S%G1438><s%> shall be abased; <S%G5013><s%> and he that humbles <S%G5013><s%> himself <S%G1438><s%> shall be exalted. <S%G5312><s%>

Then <S%G1161><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> he also <S%G2532><s%> to him that bade <S%G2564><s%> him, When <S%G3752><s%> you make <S%G4160><s%> a dinner <S%G712><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> a supper, <S%G1173><s%> call <S%G5455><s%> not your friends, <S%G5384><s%> nor <S%G3364><s%> your brothers, <S%G80><s%> neither <S%G3366><s%> your kinsmen, <S%G4773><s%> nor <S%G3364><s%> your rich <S%G4145><s%> neighbors; <S%G1069><s%> lest <S%G3379><s%> they also <S%G2532><s%> bid <S%G479><s%> you again, <S%G479><s%> and a recompense <S%G468><s%> be made <S%G1096><s%> you.
But when <S%G3752><s%> you make <S%G4160><s%> a feast, <S%G1403><s%> call <S%G2564><s%> the poor, <S%G4434><s%> the maimed, <S%G376><s%> the lame, <S%G5560><s%> the blind: <S%G5185><s%>

And you shall be blessed; <S%G3107><s%> for they cannot <S%G3756><s%> <S%G2192><s%> recompense <S%G467><s%> you: for you shall be recompensed <S%G467><s%> at <S%G1722><s%> the resurrection <S%G386><s%> of the just. <S%G1342><s%>

And when one <S%G5100><s%> of them that sat <S%G4873><s%> at <S%G4873><s%> meat with him heard <S%G191><s%> these <S%G5023><s%> things, he said <S%G2036><s%> to him, Blessed <S%G3107><s%> is he that shall eat <S%G5315><s%> bread <S%G740><s%> in the kingdom <S%G932><s%> of God. <S%G2316><s%>
Then <S%G1161><s%> said <S%G2036><s%> he to him, A certain <S%G5100><s%> man <S%G444><s%> made <S%G4160><s%> a great <S%G3173><s%> supper, <S%G1173><s%> and bade <S%G2564><s%> many: <S%G4183><s%>

And sent <S%G649><s%> his servant <S%G1401><s%> at supper <S%G1173><s%> time <S%G5610><s%> to say <S%G2036><s%> to them that were bidden, <S%G2564><s%> Come; <S%G2064><s%> for all <S%G3956><s%> things are now <S%G2235><s%> ready. <S%G2092><s%>

And they all <S%G3956><s%> with one <S%G3391><s%> consent began <S%G756><s%> to make <S%G3868><s%> excuse. <S%G3868><s%> The first <S%G4413><s%> said <S%G2036><s%> to him, I have bought <S%G59><s%> a piece of ground, <S%G68><s%> and I must <S%G2192><s%> needs <S%G318><s%> go <S%G1831><s%> and see <S%G1492><s%> it: I pray <S%G2065><s%> you have <S%G2192><s%> me excused. <S%G3868><s%>

And another <S%G2087><s%> said, <S%G2036><s%> I have bought <S%G59><s%> five <S%G4002><s%> yoke <S%G2201><s%> of oxen, <S%G1016><s%> and I go <S%G4198><s%> to prove <S%G1381><s%> them: I pray <S%G2065><s%> you have <S%G2192><s%> me excused. <S%G3868><s%>
And another <S%G2087><s%> said, <S%G2036><s%> I have married <S%G1060><s%> a wife, <S%G1135><s%> and therefore <S%G122><s%> <S%G5124><s%> I cannot <S%G3756><s%> <S%G1410><s%> come. <S%G2064><s%>

So <S%G2532><s%> that servant <S%G1401><s%> came, <S%G3854><s%> and showed <S%G518><s%> his lord <S%G2962><s%> these <S%G5023><s%> things. Then <S%G5119><s%> the master <S%G3617><s%> of the house <S%G3617><s%> being angry <S%G3710><s%> said <S%G2036><s%> to his servant, <S%G1401><s%> Go <S%G1831><s%> out quickly <S%G5030><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> the streets <S%G4113><s%> and lanes <S%G4505><s%> of the city, <S%G4172><s%> and bring <S%G1521><s%> in here <S%G5602><s%> the poor, <S%G4434><s%> and the maimed, <S%G376><s%> and the halt, <S%G5560><s%> and the blind. <S%G5185><s%>
And the servant <S%G1401><s%> said, <S%G2036><s%> Lord, <S%G2962><s%> it is done <S%G1096><s%> as you have commanded, <S%G2004><s%> and yet <S%G2089><s%> there is room. <S%G5117><s%>

And the lord <S%G2962><s%> said <S%G2036><s%> to the servant, <S%G1401><s%> Go <S%G1831><s%> out into <S%G1519><s%> the highways <S%G1327><s%> <S%G3598><s%> and hedges, <S%G5418><s%> and compel <S%G315><s%> them to come <S%G1525><s%> in, that my house <S%G3624><s%> may be filled. <S%G1072><s%>
For I say <S%G3004><s%> to you, That none <S%G3762><s%> of those <S%G1565><s%> men <S%G435><s%> which <S%G3588><s%> were bidden <S%G2564><s%> shall taste <S%G1089><s%> of my supper. <S%G1173><s%>
And there went <S%G4848><s%> great <S%G4183><s%> multitudes <S%G3793><s%> with him: and he turned, <S%G4762><s%> and said <S%G2036><s%> to them,

If <S%G1487><s%> any <S%G1536><s%> man come <S%G2064><s%> to me, and hate <S%G3404><s%> not his father, <S%G3962><s%> and mother, <S%G3384><s%> and wife, <S%G1135><s%> and children, <S%G5043><s%> and brothers, <S%G80><s%> and sisters, <S%G79><s%> yes, <S%G2089><s%> and his own <S%G1438><s%> life <S%G5590><s%> also, <S%G2532><s%> he cannot <S%G3756><s%> <S%G1410><s%> be my disciple. <S%G3101><s%>
And whoever <S%G3748><s%> does not bear <S%G941><s%> his cross, <S%G4716><s%> and come <S%G2064><s%> after <S%G3694><s%> me, cannot <S%G3756><s%> <S%G1410><s%> be my disciple. <S%G3101><s%>

For which <S%G5101><s%> of you, intending <S%G2309><s%> to build <S%G3618><s%> a tower, <S%G4444><s%> sits <S%G2523><s%> not down <S%G2523><s%> first, <S%G4412><s%> and counts <S%G5585><s%> the cost, <S%G1160><s%> whether <S%G1487><s%> he have <S%G2192><s%> sufficient to finish <S%G535><s%> it?

Lest <S%G2443><s%> <S%G3361><s%> haply, <S%G3379><s%> after he has laid <S%G5087><s%> the foundation, <S%G2310><s%> and is not able <S%G2480><s%> to finish <S%G1615><s%> it, all <S%G3956><s%> that behold <S%G2334><s%> it begin <S%G756><s%> to mock <S%G1702><s%> him,
Saying, <S%G3004><s%> This <S%G3778><s%> man <S%G444><s%> began <S%G756><s%> to build, <S%G3618><s%> and was not able <S%G2480><s%> to finish. <S%G1615><s%>

Or <S%G2228><s%> what <S%G5101><s%> king, <S%G935><s%> going <S%G4198><s%> to make <S%G4820><s%> war <S%G4171><s%> against another <S%G2087><s%> king, <S%G935><s%> sits <S%G2523><s%> not down <S%G2523><s%> first, <S%G4412><s%> and consults <S%G1011><s%> whether <S%G1487><s%> he be able <S%G1415><s%> with ten <S%G1176><s%> thousand <S%G5505><s%> to meet <S%G528><s%> him that comes <S%G2064><s%> against <S%G1909><s%> him with twenty <S%G1501><s%> thousand? <S%G5505><s%>

Or <S%G1161><s%> else, <S%G1490><s%> while the other <S%G846><s%> is yet <S%G2089><s%> a great <S%G4183><s%> way <S%G4206><s%> off, <S%G631><s%> he sends <S%G649><s%> an ambassador, <S%G4242><s%> and desires <S%G2065><s%> conditions <S%G4314><s%> of peace. <S%G1515><s%>

So <S%G3767><s%> likewise, <S%G3779><s%> whoever <S%G3956><s%> he be of you that forsakes <S%G657><s%> not all <S%G3956><s%> that he has, <S%G5224><s%> he cannot <S%G3756><s%> <S%G1410><s%> be my disciple. <S%G3101><s%>

Salt <S%G217><s%> is good: <S%G2570><s%> but if <S%G1437><s%> the salt <S%G217><s%> have lost <S%G3471><s%> his flavor, <S%G3471><s%> with which <S%G1722><s%> <S%G5101><s%> shall it be seasoned? <S%G741><s%>

It is neither <S%G3777><s%> fit <S%G2111><s%> for the land, <S%G1095><s%> nor <S%G3777><s%> yet for the dunghill; <S%G2874><s%> but men cast <S%G906><s%> it out. He that has <S%G2192><s%> ears <S%G3775><s%> to hear, <S%G191><s%> let him hear. <S%G191><s%>
